Line.Text: You and Jackie take the same elevator as usual, but go all the way down, passing by the ground floor and continuing well below that.

As the ride drags on, you think of hidden underground facilities and secret research labs; of oblivious Hong Kong tourists and chats with Lovecraftian monsters that happen right beneath their feet;[pause] of elevators that are not just elevators but cleverly disguised means of transportation that take you through an elaborate system of tunnels to an undisclosed location where bleary-eyed employees are toiling away, driven mad by revelations and forever silenced by NDAs.

Naturally, reality ends up lacking: once the door opens, all you see is a gray-walled corridor and an entrance to a small room.[pause] A man and a woman are scurrying around a VR terminal inside it, probably making some final adjustments, but step aside immediately once they notice your arrival.[pause] On Jackie’s cue you take a seat, put the headgear on, and watch as the projections cover your entire field of vision.

A minute later, you hear a voice sounding in your head. It feels completely natural, hitting all the tones and emotional subtleties as a typical human would.[pause] The spoken words, however, come to you as a bit of a surprise.
